question: The Hessian matrix obtained using scipy.minimize() can be made more accurate by

answers.answer: Making the tolerance larger
Using the SLSQP solver
Making the tolerance smaller
None of the above

question: The relation: Hessian_inverse = 2*Covariance is valid only in the case of

answers.answer: minimization using sum squared errors
minimization using absolute sum of errors
always valid
always valid for high tolerance solvers
A to be a non-singular matrix
Determinant of A not equal to zero
A to be a square matrix
All of the above

question: Which norm regression approach among the following will be more resistant to outliers

answers.answer: L2
L1
Both L1 and L2 will be equally resistant

question: For an array([1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7]), an additional entry of value 20 to the array, will

answers.answer: Not affect the median but will change the mean value
Change the mean and median both, but will have less impact on the mean
Change the mean and median both, but will have less impact on the median
Not affect the mean but will change the median value

question: For an array([1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7]), an additional entry of value 8 to the array, will

answers.answer: Will equally change the median and mean
Change the mean and median both, but will have less impact on the mean
Change the mean and median both, but will have less impact on the median
Not affect the median or the mean

question: Using L2 norm instead of L1 to minimize errors will affect the regression model in what way

answers.answer: The model will move towards the outliers
The model will move away from the outliers
The model will remain unaffected
Can't say

question: Find the median of the following set (1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 9, 13, 18, 30)
A Hessian of a scalar-valued function consists of

answers.answer: first-order partial derivatives
first-order total derivatives
second-order total derivatives
second-order partial derivatives

question: To fit a model to a set of data points which were recorded using an instrument which loses precision over time, the best choice, among the following, would be to use

answers.answer: weighted regression with weights increasing for newer points
weighted regression with weights decreasing for newer points
regular regression without weights
all would give the same results
